questions.q: If $x=tan~y$ then find the following expression $x^{2}y^{\prime}=...$
For the following limit $lim_{x\rightarrow0}\frac{ln(mx+1)^{3}}{x}=\frac{36}{k}.$ What is the following value $mk=...$
For the following two complex numbers $|z_{1}|=12,$ $|z_{2}-3-4i|=5$ Find the maximum and minimum values of $|z_{1}-z_{2}|...$
Find the value of the following expression $(\frac{a}{\omega}-\frac{a}{\omega^{2}}+\frac{3a}{\omega^{4}}-\frac{3a^{2}}{\omega^{5}})^{2}=...$
For the following expression $y=4~sin^{2}3x+4~cos^{2}3x+4~tan^{2}3x$ if $\frac{dy}{dx}=m~sec^{2}x~tan~x$ what is the value of m?
If $x=2~cos^{4}\theta$ and $y=50~sin^{4}\theta$ what is m if $y^{\prime}=-m\sqrt{\frac{y}{x}}?$
Find the value of the integral expression $\int\frac{1}{x^{2}\sqrt{4-x^{2}}}dx$

Given the following diagram, consider an infinite sequence of equilateral triangles constructed as follows: The initial triangle has a side length of a. For each subsequent triangle, its vertices are placed at the midpoints of the sides of the preceding triangle, forming a new, smaller equilateral triangle. This process continues indefinitely. Determine the sum of the areas of all triangles in this infinite sequence.
If the plane whose equation is $\frac{x-4}{1}=\frac{y-2}{1}=\frac{z-k}{2}$ contains the line $2x-my+z=7$ then find $m+k...$
Find the local maximum of $\frac{ln~x}{x^{2}}...$
If s is the displacement and is equal to meter whose equation is $s=t^{k}.$ If the velocity at time 6 seconds is equal to 4 times the velocity at 3 seconds. Find the acceleration at $t=2...$
The following function $v^{2}=1+8\sqrt{s+t}$ describes the velocity of an object moving along the -axis. Find the acceleration a of the object when $v=5$.
For the following circle, if the line passing through the point $(2\sqrt{2}a,2\sqrt{2}a)$ is tangent to the circle, find the area of the highlighted triangle.

In a study of dog populations, the known population mean is $\mu=25.$ A sample of size $n=49$ is taken, and the alternative hypothesis is $H_{1}$: $\mu\ne25$ Given that the sample mean is not equal to 25, and the calculated test statistics is one of the following, what is its value?

A researcher wishes to estimate the population mean with a 95% confidence level. The population standard deviation is known to be $\sigma=12.$ and the desired margin of error for the estimate is no more than 2.357. What is the minimum sample size required to achieve this level of precision?

what is the maximum rate of change of the following function $f(x)=2~sin~5t^{\circ}$?
A company has sells a valuable worth dollars. The revenue of the company is $R(x)=50x$ while the cost of production is $C(x)=30x+80$ What is the value to break even?

Machines A, B, and C are responsible for producing 30%, 20%, and 50% of the total items, respectively. The probabilities that each machine produces a defective item are 2% for machine A, 3% for machine B, and 4% for machine C. If an item is selected at random and is found to be defective, what is the probability that it was produced by machine B?

The rate of change of bacterial population is directly proportional to the population itself. If the bacterial population is initially 1000. It doubles every 20 minutes. Find the population after 3 hours....

A bacterial population grows according to the function $P(t)=N_{0}e^{kt},$ where t is the time. Given the initial population is $P(0)=1000$ and the population at time $t=5$ is $P(5)=2000$ find the population $P(10)$.

The drawer length of a certain circular perpendicular cone is $\sqrt{12}$ cm. Find the maximum volume of the cone.
find the inflection point of the the function $f(x)=(ln~x)^{2}$
if $\int sec^{4}x~tan^{3}x~dx=\frac{1}{m}tan^{m}x+\frac{1}{n}tan^{n}x+C$ Find the value of $m+n$

Given that the Pearson correlation coefficient is $r=0.2$, and the following conditions hold:
$\sum x^{2}=(\sum x)^{2}$,   $\sum y^{2}=(\sum y)^{2}$,   $\sum xy=\frac{1}{4}\sum x\sum y$

find the value of n, the number of data points.

The following matrix equation describes the area of a certain triangle $\begin{vmatrix}a-b-c&2c&2b\\ 2b&b-c-a&2b\\ 2b&2a&c-b-a\end{vmatrix}$ $=4913$
what is the perimeter of the triangle?

Two pipes are used to fill the same tank. The first pipe takes 5 hours less than the second to fill the tank individually. When both pipes are opened together, they can fill the tank in 6 hours. Determine the time required by each pipe to fill the tank individually.

In the following diagram, a certain area besides a river is intended to be walled off with a fence of length 200 meters. if the sides of the trapezium-like area are z and 3x, what is the maximum area that can be walled off?
what is the rate of change of the area of the triangle with respect to time in the following diagram at $x=3$ if $\frac{dx}{dt}=5~ft/s?$
